that both in-utero nutrient deprivation and excess alter normal growth patterns and result in an increased risk 
of obesity, type II diabetes mellitus (T2DM), and metabolic disorders in offspring [12,15,18,23,42,52]. 
An association between poor fetal growth, early accelerated postnatal so-called catch-up growth in offspring 
and later development of NCDs has been found in several human studies [6,9,29,58]. Such NCDs include
